parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "PeleLMeX",
  "software": [
    "PrgEnv-cray",
    "cmake",
    "cray-python",
    "craype-x86-trento",
    "craype-accel-amd-gfx90a",
    "rocm/5.4.0",
    "cray-libsci/22.12.1.1",
    "SUNDIALS",
    "PeleLMeX"
  ],
  "resource_requirements": {
    "allocation": "CMB138_crusher",
    "job_name": "LMEX_FSDRM19",
    "nodes": 1,
    "wall_time": "01:00:00",
    "gpus": 8,
    "gpu_binding": "closest"
  },
  "environment_variables": [
    "https_proxy",
    "FI_MR_CACHE_MONITOR",
    "FI_CXI_RX_MATCH_MODE"
  ]
}
```

This script runs the **PeleLMeX** application, a software package for simulating reactive flows. It leverages various software components like `PrgEnv-cray`, `cmake`, `cray-python`, and others for building and running the application. 

The script defines the necessary resources and environment variables. It utilizes an allocation called "CMB138_crusher", assigns a job name "LMEX_FSDRM19", requests a single node, sets a wall time limit of one hour, utilizes 8 GPUs per node with closest binding, and modifies specific environment variables for proxy and network performance optimization.
